comments:
I opened an XML file that is not under a project loaded in the workspace by dragging and dropping it from Windows Explorer onto the editor tab area. When I try to bring up the search dialog to search within this file using Ctrl-H, the following exception is thrown:

eclipse.buildId=M20070917-0900
java.version=1.6.0_02
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_CA
Framework arguments:  -showlocation
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -clean -showlocation

The details of WTP I'm using:

wtp-M-2.0.1RC2-20070913200918.zip
GEF-SDK-M20070814-1555.zip
emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-M200709120130.zip
dtp-sdk_1.5.1_N091207.zip

It's possible that the mismatch between the Eclipse requirement for this build and the one I'm actually using are to blame, but maybe not.
I should make it clear that the search dialog doesn't appear as a result.

com.bytemakers.ecsplorer.search.page.FileSystemSearchPage is assuming that all implementors of the IStructuredSelection interface are subclasses of StructuredSelection.  I suggest you contact and report a bug to the provider of that search page.
